channel.title: Posts on Cynthia's Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Cynthia's Portfolio

item.title: recipE-Z
item.description: recipE-Z: the recipe finder app January - May 2020 What is recipE-Z? As a way to help alleviate food waste, we built an iOS app that will present you with recipes based on the ingredients you already have. A user can enter a list of ingredients or a specific recipe and then our app will search through a database of recipes, from online or submitted by users in our app. It will present results ranging from recipes that can be made with everything the user already has to recipes that will require extra ingredients.

item.title: divvi
item.description: divvi: the bill splitting app February 2020 In February, I participated in my second hack-a-thon, CuseHacks, and our team won Best Use of Google API! What is divvi? We built a receipt scanner app called ‘divvi’ that focused on facilitating a productive conversation between you and your fellow meal splitters by itemizing your receipt and calculating the totals owed by each. We prioritized the user experience and wanted to promote chatter at the table rather than detract from it.

item.title: Plant Simulator
item.description: Plant Simulator Built in C++ OpenGL April - May 2020 For my final project in my Computer Graphics class, I built an interactive plant game, where you can plant seeds, water it, and watch it bloom! What features does it have? Particle system Swept surfaces Animation Interactions via keyboard and mouse clicks Lighting Bezier curves Bitmaps and textures Clipping planes What does it look like? Video coming soon

item.title: Youtube Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Plant Simulator Built in C++ OpenGL April - May 2020 For my final project in my Social Media and Data Mining class, I wanted to evaluate the toxcity of YouTube communities by performing sentiment analysis on YouTube comments. What was our data mining process? Storing the Data: MongoDB Because our team was working remotely and needed to share the data for analysis and examination of results, we decided to use a cloud-based database.
